column2: This colony has recently given tribute to Ulthuan.

A princely coalition has recently forced the Phoenix King to change Ulthuan's foreign policy. It would be unlikely for any noble to touch the issue for a while, for fear of destabilizing Ulthuan too much.
This character has recently won a fiery political debate.
This character was soundly defeated in a public debate but, rather than accepting defeat, clung irrationally to their beliefs.
The crowd is cheering for this character to win the finals.
You once showed up drunk to a tournament and made such a shameful spectacle of yourself that you had to be thrown out.
column3: Vous vous êtes une fois montré ivre à un tournoi, ce fut un spectacle si honteux que vous en avez été mis à la porte.
column6: Aparecio borracho en un torneo e hizo un espectáculo vergonzoso y tuvo que ser expulsado.

column2: A Bretonnian ruler lacking Virtue will find that their realm is harder to control, as nobles and peasants alike chafe under the rule of wicked and vile sovereigns. This modifier will be removed when the character reaches a positive Virtue value.

To Bretonnian nobility, Virtue and Chivalry are all. A ruler with positive Virtue will find that every soldier in their armies, nobleborn or peasant, will fight with greater fervour at the sight of a virtuous leader. These bonuses will increment as your Virtue does, up to 2000 virtue.
